item.title: Carlye add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Ammon Hennacy
item.description: "Love without courage and wisdom is sentimentality, as with the ordinary church member. Courage without love and wisdom is foolhardiness, as with the ordinary soldier. Wisdom without love and courage is cowardice, as with the ordinary intellectual. But the one who has love, courage and wisdom moves the world." -- Ammon Hennacy

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Carlye add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Nothing you have not given away will ever really be yours." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carlye add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carlye add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I gave in, and admitted that God was God." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "Do not depend on the hope of results. You may have to face the fact that your work will be apparently worthless and even achieve no result at all, if not perhaps results opposite to what you expect. As you get used to this idea, you start more and more to concentrate not on the results, but on the value, the rightness, the truth of the work itself. You gradually struggle less and less for an idea and more and more for specific people. In the end, it is the reality of personal relationship that saves everything." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Charles Du Bos
item.description: "The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become." -- Charles Du Bos

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Edwin H. Friedman
item.description: "The colossal misunderstanding of our time is the assumption that insight will work with people who are unmotivated to change. Communication does not depend on syntax, or eloquence, or rhetoric, or articulation but on the emotional context in which the message is being heard. People can only hear you when they are moving toward you, and they are not likely to when your words are pursuing them. Even the choicest words lose their power when they are used to overpower. Attitudes are the real figures of speech." -- Edwin H. Friedman

item.title: Carlye add a quote by James Yorke
item.description: "The most successful people are those who are good at plan B. " -- James Yorke

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "We are not to expect to be translated from despotism to liberty in a featherbed." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Carlye add a quote by Victor Frankl
item.description: "What man actually needs is not a tensionless state but rather the striving and struggling for some goal worthy of him. What he needs is not the discharge of tension at any cost, but the call of a potential meaning waiting to be fulfilled by him." -- Victor Frankl
